poem:
Title: Truth in the Sands

Captive souls whisper between desert dunes,
War-charmers speak of justified moons,
'Enough', echoes on walls of despair,
In a world, wary but aware.
A parley of lives in dread balance hangs,
One word, weighty as bomb-detonating pangs.
Yet, beyond mortal's measure,
Hope clings to a fragile treasure.
Tomorrow's sun may yet rise, and illuminate
A path beyond hate's iron gate.
